name: Grasé, Jan Carl Gijsbert aan Verwey, Albert | 1884-03-23

Transcription.text:
¶Wellington House
Eton Rd N.W.
23rd Mrch '84

My dear Verwey,

You must have been astonished at my long silence, and trying to find out the reason of it. I have been attempting to digest yr blessing of last month; but I have not yet succeeded [pro?] [dei?] gloria still sticks in my throat & so I have given it up as a hopeless task & am now able to return it to you. But no humbug how are you getting on; and how did you enjoy yrself at the entertainment last week. or rather the 1st of Mrch. I have only got a rather incomplete account of it, from Dietz, and I ¶know as much about it as before, or perhaps less, as it destroyed some notions I had made beforehand about it. What did you do? And how are the rules getting on. Chopped, maimed, plastered, wounded & healed? When is yr discussion? What about [the?] Brd of Dir? Are you in?
    I have not been able to get the rules of the Hampstead Parliament.
    Ducky, do you intend to go to America? Or will you come to London this year. By God I begin to hate English people on account of their beastly hypocrasy. Look at the Soudan. Beasts they are, slaughtering thousands of Arabs ¶and calling them rebels and offering fl 2500. reward for anyone who captures their leader dead or alive. I am disgusted with the Nineteenth Century. I suppose it is not perfect enough for me. Perhaps the reverse?
    How are the Boers getting on in Amsterdam. Is Kuyper connecting them to orthodox principles? and will they get their money? Have you invested any of yr property in Transvaal bonds.?
    I was told two awfully good stories this morning coming home from church. Which are the 3 men in the Bible that could not shit?
    1 Cain because he was not Able
    2. Bileam, because his ass (arse) was ¶stopped en 3. Timothy Titus. You know the way some swells pronounce the latter word, like waiter (ah).
    Who was the first pugilist?
    The good young man himself. When he walked on the sea, and thus frightened his disciples he said: (H)it is I. (hit is eye) don't be afraid.
    The Lord be with you for ever also when you cross the N.Z Voorburgwal, & at the ADL&DS.

Yrs sincerly
G. Grasé.
